intro: Eriocaulon anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swamps and seasonally flooded areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its roots are often submerged, helping to stabilize soil and improve water filtration in wetlands. Eriocaulon anceps plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
